doctors.name: The 1st Doctor
doctors.info: Doddering. Hmmn. Hmmn. Hmmn. Yes. Go forward in all your beliefs. Enigmatic alien. Radioactive cinder. Grandfather. Irascible. Chesterton. Lapels. Ormulu clock. Querulous. Fast return switch.

doctors.name: The 2nd Doctor
doctors.info: Cosmic hobo. Baggy trousers. When I say run. Recorder. Stovepipe hat. Twinkling eyes. Butterfingers. Jamie, Jamie, hold on! More info, more info again

doctors.name: The 3rd Doctor
doctors.info: Dandy. Yellow car. Purple velvet. UNIT Family. Worzel Gummidge. Venusian karate. Klokeda partha menin klatch. Whomobile. Action by HAVOC. All wearing eyepatches.

doctors.name: The 4th Doctor
doctors.info: 750 years old. Teeth and curls. Jelly babies. Lovable robot dog. Ahhhhh-har. Scarf. Have I the right? Ooh, my everything! It's the end...

doctors.name: The 5th Doctor
doctors.info: Cricketer. Brave heart, Tegan. Pleasant, open face. Wet vet. Kamelion. Celery. Master's cunning disguises.Uses Cyberman's gun to kill cyberman. Episode: Earthshock

doctors.name: The 6th Doctor
doctors.info: Brash. Cat badge. Video nasty. Cancelled. Hiatus. Doctor in distress. Valeyard. Carrot juice. Carrot juice. Carrot juice

doctors.name: The 7th Doctor
doctors.info: Spoons. Braces. Cartmel masterplan. Panama hat. Umbrella. Ace! Rrrrrolling rrrrrrs. Professor! Wicked! Cliffhanger. Pullover. Dark and mysterious. Burnt toast.

doctors.name: The 8th Doctor
doctors.info: Kissing. Shoes. Grace. Beryllium clock. Half human. Who am I? Eye of harmony. Nice TARDIS.

doctors.name: The 9th Doctor
doctors.info:
He survived the Time War, but continued the fight against evil in all its forms. Rose gave him a new lease of life - and he gave it all up to save her.

Quote:'What's life, life's easy, a quirk of matter, natures way of keeping meat fresh.'

doctors.name: The 10th Doctor
doctors.info: He's a Time Lord from the planet Gallifrey. He's 903 years old. If there's danger, he's the man who's going to save your life - and everyone on your planet. Got a problem with that?

doctors.name: The 11th Doctor
doctors.info: I'm the Doctor, I'm an alien from outer space, I'm 1,000 years old, I've got two hearts, and I can't fly a plane. Can You?

companions.info:
When the Doctor fled Gallifrey in his stolen TARDIS, he was accompanied by his 15 year old granddaughter, Susan. Together they explored Revolutionay France, 19th century England, and Ancient Greece, met Pyrrho, Henry VIII, and Beau Brummel, and saw metal seas and telepathic plants on planets like Venus, Esto and Quinnis. Eventually they settled in 1963 London so the Doctor could repair the TARDIS. While there Susan enrolled in school. 
While in school Susan met her teaches Ian Chesterton and Barbara Wright. . . .
Susan Foreman's Science teacher, that after going to check on Susan's home life accidentally ended up traveling with the Doctor and Susan.
Susan Foreman's History teacher, that after going to check on Susan's home life accidentally ended up traveling with the Doctor and Susan.
A teenaged orphan from the 25th century. she was marooned on the planet Dido after a spaceship crash. Missing Susan the Doctor offered her a place on the Tardis.

A spaceship pilot who crashed landed on the planet Mechanus, where he was imprisoned my the Mechonoids. He was freed from his two year captivity when the Daleks pursued the Tardis to Mechanus. he eventually found his why to the Tardis and joined the Tardis crew.
The handmaiden to Princess Cassandra in ancient Troy, Katrina briefly traveled with the Doctor and crew after helping an injured Steven back to the TARDIS.

Having stumbled into the TARDIS thinking it was a real police box, she was totally unfazed when she stepped out into a jungle area aboard a huge space ark carrying humans and animals away from a doomed future Earth.
Able Seaman Ben Jackson only got involved with the Doctor because Polly took pity on him when she saw him sitting on his own in a nightclub.
When Polly met the Doctor she was working as a secretary for the inventor on the WOTAN. Though she was briefly hypnotized by the supercomputer, her loyalty to her friends overcame her conditioning.

The Doctor, Ben, and Polly meet Jamie in Scotland in April 1746, shortly after the Battle of Culloden. Jamie, a piper, was uneducated and uncomplicated but brave, resourceful and unwaveringly loyal to his clan chief. Having helped defeat a band of English slave traders, Jamie accepted the Doctors's invitation to join him on his travels.
though she accepted the Doctor's invitation to board the TARDIS after the Daleks killed her father, Victoria was an unwilling traveller.

A first-class astrophysicist and astrometricist aboard a 21st-century space station, the Wheel, Zoe had a reputation among her colleagues as being all brain and no heart. Realising that there might be more to life, she stowed away on the TARDIS

When the Third Doctor began his exile on Earth, Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart had already decided to recruit a scientific adviser for UNIT. He drafted Professor Elizabeth Shaw in from Cambridge University since she had, ,he said, degrees in medicine, physics and 'a dozen other subjects'. Liz was reluctant to become involved and highly sceptical of the Brigadier's claims that he had repelled two previous invasions of Earth with the assistance of a mysterious genius.

When a high-ranking UN official pulled some strings to secure his niece's appointment at UNIT, the Doctor was dismayed to learn that the clumsy young girl who had just ruined one of his experiments was to be his new assistant.

Sarah Jane a strong a strong-willed and enthusiastic supporter of women's rights, became a journalist, joining Metropolitan magazine by the age of 23. Investigating the disappearances of top scientists, she infiltrated a secret research centre. There she encountered the Doctor, who she suspected of kidnapping the scientist. Hiding aboard the TARDIS her adventures began.

The newly regenerated Doctor was placed in the care of UNIT's medical officer, Surgeon-Lieutenant Harry Sullivan, who soon found himself going undercover at Thinktank, being held hostage, and helping the Doctor develop a metal-eating virus to destroy a giant robot. But when Harry agreed to a 'little trip to the moon', he was astonished to be transported to a space station in the far future, where he helped the Doctor revive the cryogenically frozen survivors of solar flares that had devastated Earth.

Leela was a warrior of the tribe of Sevateem, the primitive descendents of a lost space expedition from Earth. Although she was highly intelligent and learned quickly, her knowledge and experience were limited, and she had a simple, spontaneous approach to life. Reluctantly taking her aboard the TARDIS, the Doctor became something of a mentor to her, teaching her to read and write and to look for a scientific explanation rather than a magical one, and showing her the wonders of the universe and humanity's history.

Medical complex the Bi-Al Foundation was built into an asteroid in the late 50th century, and among it's senior staff was a specialist in extraterrestrial diseases, Professor Marius. On his appointment, Marius discovered that weight restrictions prevented him from taking his pet dog, so he constructed a talking mobile computer . . .

Romanadvoratrelunder was a recent graduate from the Time Lord Academy, academically gifted - she attained a triple first - but naive and inexperienced. She believed she had been sent on her first mission be the Time Lord President, though this was in fact the disguised White Guardian, and she quickly found that the Doctor resented having her foisted upon him.
Faced with a companion wearing someone else's body, the Doctor initially told Romana to have another go, and she tried out threes other forms before settling again on Astra's

When the TARDIS slipped through a portal from our 'N-Space' into the smaller universe of 'E-Space', the Doctor and Romana found themselves on the planer Alzarius. Here they met Adric, a rebellious teenager with a gift for mathematics and a tendency to sulk if he didn't get his own way.

Nyssa was the orphaned daughter of Tremas, one of the ruling Consuls of the Union of the Traken. After a failed attempt to take over Traken, the Master stole Tremas's body, leaving Nyssa orphaned. She contacted the TARDIS . . .
Tegan Jokanka was on her way to her first day's work as an air stewardess when, stopping to repaid a fat tyre, her curiosity led her into the TARDIS.
Exiled from Trion and stranded on Earth, Turlough dreamed of returning home, which he ultimately did when offered the chance.

Travelled with the Doctor between The King's Demons and Planet of Fire.

Kamelion was a shape-shifting android which was discovered by the Master on Xeriphas. The Master used Kamelion to impersonate King John, in a plan to prevent the Magna Carta from being signed. Controlled by telekinetic power, the Doctor gained control of Kamelion during a battle of wills with the Master.

Capable of independent thought, Kamelion asked to join the Doctor, Tegan and Turlough, and was welcomed aboard. Although Kamelion travelled with the Doctor for some time, the android rarely appeared. Kamelion eventually came under the influence of the Master again, and was destroyed by the Doctor.

Perpugilliam Brown known as Peri, was a 19-year-old botany student from the US. Bored during a family holiday in Lanzarote that had turned out to be an archaeological field trip and marooned on her stepfather's boat she was rescued by Turlough and taken aboard the TARDIS.

Mel was a computer programmer from Pease Pottage, with a photographic memory. She had a passion for exercise and healthy living, which she tried to pass on to the Sixth Doctor, prescribing carrot juice and an exercise bike regime. The Doctor first encountered her during his trial by the Time Lords, though she already knew him, having travelled with him in his own future.

A rebellious tomboy who lied about her age (16 not 18), ace was one of the 'wolves of Feric' - unwitting human carriers of Fenric's evil. Imprisoned by the Doctor centuries earlier, Fenric now caused a time storm to reat Ace from her home in 1980s Pervale and dump her on Iceworld, where she met the Doctor. Recognising Fenric's influence, the Doctor took her with him in the TARDIS. Test stuff 1

Travelling alone and diverted by the Master to San Francisco on 31 December 1999, the Doctor was caught in a gangland war and shot down. Although the bullets did little actual damage, the Doctor's hearts were beating dangerously fast, so hospital staff - dismissing his twin hearts as a double-exposed X-ray - called in cardiologist Grace Holloway.

Nineteen years old, living with her mum on a South London council estate and working in Henrik's department store, Rose Tyler was bored with her mundane life. When the Doctor offered her the trip of a lifetime, nothing would ever be the same again.

Quote: 'I am the Bad Wolf, I create myself. I take the words, I scatter them in time and space, a message to lead myself here.'

Mickey Smith was Rose Tyler's boyfriend when she first meet the Doctor during the Nestene invasion. Swallowed by a Nestene-controlled wheelie bin, held captive in the alien's lair and duplicated, Mickey's usually laid-back attitude crumbled - terrified, he was automatically suspicious of the alien Doctor who Rose hooked up with.

Captain Jack Harkness, real name unknown, was an ex-time agent from the 51st century, who grew up on the Boeshane Peninsula where he was nicknamed the Face of Boe. Discovering that the Time Agency had erased two years from his memory, he quit and became a conman, meeting Rose and the Doctor when he tried to trick them into buying a 'harmless piece of space junk'.
Donna Nobel, an office temp from Chiswick, had an unwelcome introduction the the Doctor when she suddenly appeared inside the TARDIS on her wedding day.

Martha Jones was a medical student at the Royal Hope, soon to qualify as a doctor, when the hospital was stolen by the Judoon. Astonished as she was to find herself on the moon watching real aliens marching across its surface in pursuit of a fugitive Plasmavore, Martha remained calm, immediately starting to think through what had happened an how the patients and staff were still alive and able to breathe. Impressed by Martha's level-headed intelligence, the Doctor happily let her join his investigation.

Astrid Peth had always dreamed of seeing other planets and stars. As a waitress on the Titanic's Christmas cruise from Sto to Earth, she was not allowed off the ship and had resigned herself to spending the voyage waiting on tables when she met the Doctor.

Jackson Lake was a mathematics teacher from Sussex who was moving to London to take up a post at the University. He arrived in London in early December 1851 with his wife Caroline and their son Frederic and moved into 15 Latimer Street. There, in the cellars, he discovered a squad of Cybermen which had fallen out of the Void and through time as the Daleks assembled their Reality Bomb. The Cybermen killed Caroline and abducted Frederic, leaving Lake behind. But Jackson had found an Infostamp containing data about the Doctor which the Cybermen had stolen from the Daleks. The info stamp backfired and streamed this data into Jackson's mind. He became convinced that he was the Doctor, charged with defending London against the Cybermen and their Cybershades before he could leave the city in has 'Tardis' - a hot air balloon of his own invention.

Christina was a bored aristocrat who'd taken to carrying out increasingly daring high-profile burglaries to get a bit of adventure into her life. Her latest haul was a priceless medieval drinking cup, stolen from London's International Gallery. She was witty, self-assured and inventive, devising extravagant and elaborate means of liberating priceless artefacts from behind layers of security. She had attracted the dogged attentions of a Detective Inspector McMillian, who was finally closing in on her. Then she met a madman on a London bus, just moments before the whole vehicle was transported through space to the desert world on San Helios. With no way back to Earth and under threat from alien predators, all they could rely on was the Doctor's experience, Christina's extensive collection of tools and their wits. Thankfully, she and the Doctor made the perfect team.
Information Pending
The new companion traveling with the 11th Doctor. - Information Pending
Amy's Husband. Mr Pond if you like.

villains.info: The Daleks are one of the Doctors oldest enemies.
The evil scientist who created the Daleks in order to ensure the survival of his race and, ultimately, their mastery over all of creation.

Steel giants with the strength of ten men. Their enemies face a choice - become like the Cybermen... or be deleted!

Here's a list of all the classic episodes they appeared in..
A renegade Time Lord and archenemy of the Doctor.
Devoted to a live of warfare, the Sontarans are the finest soldiers in the galaxy.
A race a war with the Santorans
Lady Cassandra O'Brien Dot Delta Seventeen
The Gelth are extoplasmic, ethereal, wraith-like creatures.
'Slitheen' a family name. Coming from the planet Raxacoriclfallapatorius, the huge Slitheen are a family dedicated to business.
Pilot Fish, at least that's what the Doctor calls them.
The Wire, the TV from hell.
A species born to serve could never survive.
A race of blood-suckers that feed off the carbon dioxide, glucose, hormones, mineral ions and proteins contained in the blood plasma fluid.

villains.name_called: Prof Richard Lazarus aka Lazarus Creature

villains.info: The Adipose are a race of creatures entirely composed of fat.
An example of Sto' highly developed robotics technology.
A space travel Whale like creature.

allies.info:
"Jackie Tyler, Rose's Mum, now where the hell is my daughter?"
Jackie Tyler was a single mum, working out of her council flat as a hairdresser. Naturally chatty and friendly, she began flirting with the Doctor as soon as she laid eyes on him.

Mickey Smith was Rose Tyler's boyfriend when she first meet the Doctor during the Nestene invasion. Swallowed by a Nestene-controlled wheelie bin, held captive in the alien's lair and duplicated, Mickey's usually laid-back attitude crumbled - terrified, he was automatically suspicious of the alien Doctor who Rose hooked up with.

On parallel Earth, Pete Tyler had survived to become a successful businessman - no daughter, though still married to Jackie. This Pete recognised the dangers in the creation of the Cybermen and leaked information to try to stop it. He was too late, and his wife was among thousand converted to Cyberform. But when the Cybermen crossed from his world to ours and battled Daleks at the Torchwood Instituted, Pete found himself with a new family as Rose, Jackie and Mickey were trapped in the parallel world.
From an alternate dimension.
Sarah Jane Smiths son.
Sarah Jane Smiths Super computer
Ianto Jones from Torchwood 3
Gwen Cooper from Torchwood 3

This special intelligence taskforce was formed in the aftermath of the Yeti invasion of the London Underground, its mission to investigate the odd and the unexplained and to defend Earth from alien threats. It drew its personnel largely from the regular army of each of its host nations, including its senior personnel, although it was also empowered to draft in scientific or medical help.

Sarah Jane a strong a strong-willed and enthusiastic supporter of women's rights, became a journalist, joining Metropolitan magazine by the age of 23. Investigating the disappearances of top scientists, she infiltrated a secret research centre. There she encountered the Doctor, who she suspected of kidnapping the scientist. Hiding aboard the TARDIS her adventures began.

Medical complex the Bi-Al Foundation was built into an asteroid in the late 50th century, and among it's senior staff was a specialist in extraterrestrial diseases, Professor Marius. On his appointment, Marius discovered that weight restrictions prevented him from taking his pet dog, so he constructed a talking mobile computer . . .

Martha's family, Francine Jones(mother), Clive Jones(father), Tish Jones(sister),& Leo Jones(brother). Clive, Francine, and Tish were all enslaved  aboard the Valiant, where they joined an attempted revolt against the Master. Leo, meanwhile, proved that he was smarter than he looked when the Master interrupted a call between him and Martha. He heeded Martha's warning and went into hiding. He was therefore the only member of the Jones family not to remember 'the year that never was' of the Master's reign.

Nineteen years old, living with her mum on a South London council estate and working in Henrik's department store, Rose Tyler was bored with her mundane life. When the Doctor offered her the trip of a lifetime, nothing would ever be the same again.

When a message on his psychic paper asked him to go to The Library, the Doctor met a 51st-century archaeology professor who claimed  to have known him for years. River Song was clever and self-assured and seemed to be someone who, one day, would be very important to the Doctor. She kept a diary of her experiences with the Doctor in his future, partly as a means of establishing where they were in his timeline each time they met. She also had a 'squareness gun' - the sonic blaster Captain Jack had left in the TARDIS - and an upgraded sonic screwdriver which the Doctor had given her the last time she'd seen him.  Distrusted by the Doctor, River Song's proof that he would one day trust her absolutely was that she knew his real name - something he had never told anyone. Indeed, the Doctor said that he could think of only one occasion when he might tel anyone his name, though he did not specify when that might be. but it was enough to convince him she was telling the truth.

Martha Jones was a medical student at the Royal Hope, soon to qualify as a doctor, when the hospital was stolen by the Judoon. Astonished as she was to find herself on the moon watching real aliens marching across its surface in pursuit of a fugitive Plasmavore, Martha remained calm, immediately starting to think through what had happened an how the patients and staff were still alive and able to breathe. Impressed by Martha's level-headed intelligence, the Doctor happily let her join his investigation.

Corporal Benton was one of the earliest wave of Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart's regular army recruits, who first met the Doctor during the attack on Earth by the Cybermen. Promoted to Sergeant and later to Warrant Officer, Benton proved a dependable member of the Brigadier's HQ staff. He was liked and trusted by UNIT troops and always fought from the front as Earth faced a series of alien attacks.

Alistair Gordon Lethbridge-Stewart first met the Doctor in the London Underground during the Yeti invasion. At first suspicions of the Doctor, Colonel Lethbridge-Stewart had to concede that the Great Intelligence's attack could not have been repelled without him.

Captain Michael Yates seemed the ideal officer to be UNIT's second in command - unflappable, efficient and on good terms with his men. But when he was hypnotised by the supercomputer BOSS and forced to work against his UNIT colleagues, Yates found his loyalties tested. Recovering from the experience, he was recruited by the secret organisation behind Operation Golden Age - a plan to roll back time and depopulate Earth. Discretely dismissed from UNIT, he tried to make amends by alerting Sarah Jane Smith to events at a meditation centre involving the giant spiders of Metebelis Three.
Torchwood 3, led by Captain Jack Harkness

Captain Jack Harkness, real name unknown, was an ex-time agent from the 51st century, who grew up on the Boeshane Peninsula where he was nicknamed the Face of Boe. Discovering that the Time Agency had erased two years from his memory, he quit and became a conman, meeting Rose and the Doctor when he tried to trick them into buying a 'harmless piece of space junk'. Current leader of Torchwood 3.
Toshiko Sato, a member of Torchwood 3
Torchwood 1, Based in London led by Yvonne Hartman
